dt: {bc}to turn completely about in position or direction
{bc}to cause to take an opposite point of view
{bc}to overthrow, set aside, or make void (a legal decision) by a contrary decision
{bc}to undo or negate the effect of (something, such as a condition or surgical operation)
{bc}to cause to go in the opposite direction
{bc}to cause (something, such as an engine) to perform its action in the opposite direction
{bc}to turn or move in the opposite direction

dt.t: the count's waltzing … consisted … of {it}reversing{/it} at top speed

dt: {bc}to put a mechanism (such as an engine) in reverse
{bc}to make a sudden {a_link|reversal} in direction or opinion

pt: {sc}reverse{/sc} {sc}transpose{/sc} {sc}invert{/sc} mean to change to the opposite position. {sc}reverse{/sc} is the most general term and may imply change in order, side, direction, meaning.

pt.t: {it}reversed{/it} his position on the trade agreement

pt: {sc}transpose{/sc} implies a change in order or relative position of units often through exchange of position.

pt.t: {it}transposed{/it} the letters to form an anagram

pt: {sc}invert{/sc} applies chiefly to turning upside down or inside out.

shortdef: to turn completely about in position or direction
to cause to take an opposite point of view

stems: had two people's situations been reversed
if two people's situations been reversed

dt: used to say how someone would have done something if he or she and another person had been in each other's situations

dt.t: {it}If/Had their situations been reversed{/it}, she would have done the same.

shortdef: —used to say how someone would have done something if he or she and another person had been in each other's situations
